title: Ticket #5758: Docker volume mounts should be an expression
description:
Docker volume mounts should be an expression, not a fixed list. The expression should be evaluated within the context of the machine and job ad.

Use case: We have local users who need a particular NFS server volume mounted for their jobs, but we don't want to expose this for grid-based jobs that may be running on the same cluster.
remarks:
2016-Aug-02 20:16:37 by bbockelm:
Wow, that's ... some name.

What about the more often used EXPR suffix instead of MOUNT_IF? That matches what I'd expect HTCondor to do.

2016-Aug-03 07:51:03 by gthain:
We talked a lot about naming. _EXPRS often means insert this expression into the ad, like SUBMIT_EXPRS. We though about _REQUIREMENTS, but rejected it for various reasons

2016-Aug-03 14:05:34 by bbockelm:
Indeed, that's what EXPRS means. However, for _EXPR:
  • DEFRAG_WHOLE_MACHINE_EXPR
  • STARTD_AD_REEVAL_EXPR

The following additionally use the value of the evaluated expression:

  • TRANSFER_QUEUE_USER_EXPR
  • MODIFY_REQUEST_EXPR_*
  • GRIDMANAGER_SELECTION_EXPR

However, _IF is not used anywhere.
